hypotheses.description: Can linear models adequately predict sap flow in European Beech trees compared to more sophisticated machine learning techniques such as random forest, extreme gradient boosting, and neural networks?
hypotheses.data_set: Five-year sap flow datasets on European Beech trees (Fagus sylvatica) from 2012-2015 and 2017
hypotheses.findings: LM had maximum prediction power with a 1-hour shift of global radiation, and provided comparable prediction power to RF and XGBM. NN exhibited poor prediction power.
